staff.title: What is Decorative Plasterwork?
staff.subtitle: Discover this ancestral technique of ornamental plastering
staff.definition_p1: Decorative plasterwork (staff) is a traditional composite material combining plaster, plant fibres and a metal framework. This technique creates decorative elements of incomparable finesse and lightness.
staff.definition_p2: Used since Antiquity and perfected over the centuries, decorative plasterwork is the material of choice for exceptional architectural ornaments: mouldings, cornices, ceiling roses, columns, capitals and much more.
staff.quote_text: "Everything is possible with decorative plasterwork, there are no limits..."

hero.title: About Us
hero.subtitle: Ornamental plasterer and traditional craftsman since 2006

story.title: The Art of Decorative Plasterwork, A Passion and a Craft
story.paragraph1: Ornamental plasterer and traditional craftsman, Alexandre Chaligné began his career in 2006 in the Bordeaux region, where he obtained his CAP and BP in plastering and specialised in decorative plasterwork, an exceptional technique particularly suited to this region.
story.paragraph2: Decorative plasterwork became his passion: this ancestral technique creates ornaments of incomparable finesse. Mouldings, cornices, ceiling roses, columns... each creation testifies to expertise passed down through generations.
story.paragraph3: Since 2006, Alexandre Chaligné has completed prestigious projects: Bordeaux châteaux (Canon, Montrose, Pichon Longueville, Du Glana), historic monuments (Grand Théâtre de Bordeaux, listed churches) and projects in Switzerland (prestigious villas in Geneva).
story.paragraph4: Each project represents a technical and artistic challenge, combining respect for traditional techniques in heritage restoration and exploration of new possibilities for contemporary creations.
story.paragraph5: The company "A.Chaligné" was created to develop the market for decorative plasterwork and traditional plastering in Eastern France, perpetuating these exceptional techniques that enhance spaces with authenticity.
story.quote_text: "Everything is possible with decorative plasterwork, there are no limits..."

faq.title: Have Questions?
faq.description: Find quick answers to the most common questions
faq.q1_question: How long does it take to receive a quote?
faq.q1_answer: We commit to responding within 24 to 48 hours of receiving your request. The detailed quote will be sent after a site visit.
faq.q2_question: Do you work on projects in Switzerland?
faq.q2_answer: Yes, being based in Ville-la-Grand near the Swiss border, we regularly work in Switzerland, particularly in the Lake Geneva region.
faq.q3_question: Do you offer guarantees on your work?
faq.q3_answer: All our work is covered by legal guarantees (10-year guarantee, completion guarantee). We have all the professional insurance necessary.
faq.q4_question: Do you work on listed buildings?
faq.q4_answer: Yes, Alexandre Chaligné is trained in heritage restoration techniques and is accustomed to working on listed historic buildings.
faq.q5_answer: Lead times vary depending on the nature and scale of the project. For standard work, allow generally 2 to 6 weeks after quote approval.
faq.q6_question: Is there a minimum budget required?
faq.q6_answer: As each project is unique, there is no fixed minimum budget. However, given the high-end nature of our services, projects generally start from €5,000.

meta.title: Château du Glana - Alexandre CHALIGNÉ
meta.description: Insulation and design of Château du Glana

hero.title: Château du Glana
hero.subtitle: Heritage restoration combining thermal insulation and restoration of historic decorations

intro.title: The Project
intro.lead: Château du Glana, a prestigious Médoc wine estate, underwent delicate work combining modern energy performance with preservation of architectural heritage.
intro.description: The work focused on complete restoration of the ornamental ceilings in the reception rooms, while integrating high-performance thermal insulation.

challenge.title: The Challenge
challenge.description: Renovating a listed historic monument while respecting strict heritage standards, whilst significantly improving the building's energy performance.

solution.title: The Solution
solution.description: An innovative approach combining interior insulation with breathable materials and identical reproduction of decorative elements. We created a complete metal framework on which we fixed 'nerfgalto' lathing.

features.title: Project Highlights
features.subtitle: When heritage and modernity combine
features.feature1_description: Integration of high-performance insulation while preserving interior volumes
features.feature2_description: Faithful reproduction of historic decorations using traditional techniques
features.feature3_description: Respect for heritage authority constraints and enhancement of listed architectural heritage
features.feature4_description: Reconstruction of ceiling roses, cornices and 18th-century ornamental details

process.title: Execution Process
process.subtitle: A rigorous and respectful approach
process.step1_description: In-depth historical study, photogrammetric surveys and heritage authority approval of interventions
process.step2_description: Production of moulds from preserved original elements for faithful reproduction
process.step3_description: Installation of thermal insulation and preparation of supports for decorations
process.step4_description: Installation of plasterwork elements and finishes according to period techniques

results.quote_text: An exemplary intervention demonstrating that heritage preservation and energy improvement can be reconciled.
